title: We four.
author: Rees, L. L.
snippet: Crombie and wife lie tere in eflfigy, with inscriptions on their sarcophagi extolling their virtues.

title: The black watch.
author: Picken, Andrew
snippet: " Fire the thatch, I say ! burst in the windows  !"" cried Crombie, and in a minute fire and smoke arose from various parts of the building.

title: The black watch.
author: Picken, Andrew
snippet: " Fire !"" cried the enraged Crombie, and in another instant the glen rung with the echo, of near a hundred j^muskets, whose idle balls rattled back from the walls of the tower.

title: The black watch.
author: Picken, Andrew
snippet: " One more," cried Crombie ; and another soldier joining, they gave it a simultaneous stroke, which was equally ineffective.

title: The black watch.
author: Picken, Andrew
snippet: " Force the door of the tower," cried Crombie ; " we will soon unkennel these rebel dogs.""

title: The black watch.
author: Picken, Andrew
snippet: In the strange officer Hector at once recognized his ominous enemy, Crombie of Libberton, who was no less astonished to see before him, one whom he had left for dead on the plain of Fontenoy.

title: The black watch.
author: Picken, Andrew
snippet: But his eagerness to wed my Helen to my mortal enemy, Crombie of Libberton, has cost her and myself many a sleepless night.

title: The black watch.
author: Picken, Andrew
snippet: Acting busily as one of the justices  for the county, his happiness in being the means of obtaining the first examination of a delinquent,  so important as Hector was represented  to be, was somewhat damped, on finding the charge against him supported by such inadequate  evidence as young Crombie, who now confronted him, or his rascally minion, Saunders Murchie, who had dogged him the whole way from Scotland, and obtained a warrant for detaining  him at various places on the road, were able to produce.

title: The black watch.
author: Picken, Andrew
snippet: " Saunders," cried Crombie, authora- tively, to the elder stranger ; he then took him aside, and an animated and hasty whisper passed between them.

title: The black watch.
author: Picken, Andrew
snippet: Hector, watching his opportunity,  with a clean stroke, cut this ornament from its place, upon which a shout was set up that the contest was gained ; but Crombie, with glaring eyes and clenched teeth, still continuing his efforts for one cut at his adversary, a cry from several voices of " Let him have it ! give him the steel !" emboldened Hector to another aim, and avoiding a blow of the exasperated young man, he returned its intention by a dexterous  touch of his point at the inside joint of Crombie's shoulder.

title: The black watch.
author: Picken, Andrew
snippet: hae to do the morn ? If ye dinna drink to put strength in you, after fasting all day, where do you think ye'll be when ye come before the ladies ; and what'll I do for my ten guineas ? Odd, if ye just drink another caupful like that, I'll wager five red guineas more on your head — for it would gravel me to the bottom o' my stomach, to see that knoity-kneed Crombie win the day, although he be of quality.

title: The black watch.
author: Picken, Andrew
snippet: mother, who was a Campbell, his life has been mostly spent in the Lowlands, where he was born, and where, no doubt, the breadth and width of his father's estates, besides the title, he being the eldest son, is the chief foundation to the lady's father to encoul-age this match ; for well I wot, Crombie himself is no great bargain to tempt a bonnie young lassie, either for his outward man or his inner.

title: The black watch.
author: Picken, Andrew
snippet: How his honour, young Crombie, has learned to be sic a champion, I know not ; for though he has great lands in the Highlands, by riglit of his
